US Federal Reserve cuts rates to boost economy
subhead: The Fed announced a quarter-point interest rate cut on Wednesday. Two additional quarter-point cuts are expected at upcoming Fed meetings in October and December, depending on economic data released in the meantime.

title: ABC says Jimmy Kimmel off air 'indefinitely' after Charlie Kirk comments
subhead: Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show was abruptly pulled off the air Wednesday, just hours after the federal government threatened to revoke broadcast licenses over comments Kimmel made about the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

title: French national library seeks patrons to acquire rare archive of Marcel Proust's works
subhead: Drafts, sketches, unpublished fragments, manuscripts of poems... The institution launched a public fundraising campaign at the beginning of September to ensure that these 900 items, valued at €7.7 million, remain part of France's national heritage.

title: Antarctica's tourism boom accelerates melting of 'white continent'
subhead: While the number of tourists has skyrocketed over the past decade, the pristine continent, which is attracting growing interest among researchers, is gradually deteriorating.

title: French border police accused of causing shipwrecks and deaths of migrants from Comoros
subhead: Since 2010, several hundred Comorians have died at sea while trying to reach the French overseas territory of Mayotte. A joint investigation by Le Monde and Lighthouse Reports shows that police maneuvers are implicated in several of these shipwrecks.
